            <title>[CRYPTO-159] JRE (x86) crash (EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-159</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I have tested commons-crypto on Windows 7 and 10 and Java 32 bit with&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
java -cp commons-crypto-1.1.0.jar org.apache.commons.crypto.Crypto
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;but got a JRE crash . See attachment &apos;hs_err_pid4640.log&apos;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Additional info: Tested successfully with JRE&#160;1.8.0_201 (x86_64):&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
java -cp commons-crypto-1.1.0.jar org.apache.commons.crypto.Crypto
Apache Commons Crypto 1.1.0
Native code loaded OK: 1.1.0-SNAPSHOT
Native name: Apache Commons Crypto
Native built: Aug 16 2020
OpenSSL library loaded OK, version: 0x1000215f
OpenSSL library info: OpenSSL 1.0.2u  20 Dec 2019
Random instance created OK: org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpenSslCryptoRandom@4a574795
Cipher AES/CTR/NoPadding instance created OK: org.apache.commons.crypto.cipher.OpenSslCipher@87aac27
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
java -cp commons-crypto-1.1.0.jar org.apache.commons.crypto.Crypto
Apache Commons Crypto 1.1.0
Native code loaded OK: 1.1.0-SNAPSHOT
Native name: Apache Commons Crypto
Native built: Aug 16 2020
OpenSSL library loaded OK, version: 0x101010bf
OpenSSL library info: OpenSSL 1.1.1k  25 Mar 2021
Random instance created OK: org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpenSslCryptoRandom@4a574795
Cipher AES/CTR/NoPadding instance created OK: org.apache.commons.crypto.cipher.OpenSslCipher@87aac27
&lt;/pre&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-158] Illegal reflective access</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-158</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Getting this message:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;WARNING: An illegal reflective access operation has occurred&lt;br/&gt;
WARNING: Illegal reflective access by org.apache.commons.crypto.stream.CryptoInputStream (.../BOOT-INF/lib/commons-crypto-1.1.0.jar!/) to method sun.nio.ch.DirectBuffer.cleaner()&lt;br/&gt;
WARNING: Please consider reporting this to the maintainers of org.apache.commons.crypto.stream.CryptoInputStream&lt;br/&gt;
WARNING: Use --illegal-access=warn to enable warnings of further illegal reflective access operations&lt;br/&gt;
WARNING: All illegal access operations will be denied in a future release&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>Linux OpenJDK 15.0.2</environment>
        <key id="13365877">CRYPTO-158</key>
            <summary>Illegal reflective access</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-157] Authentication tag length cannot be specified for CryptoInputStream</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-157</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;CryptoInputStream and CryptoOutputStream are not allowing other AlgorithmParameterSpec than IvParameterSpec. B they both claim to support any mode of operations, but without submitting a GCMParameterSpec its not possible to define a authentication tag length in GCM mode. Despite of that I am not sure if cipher in GCM is ever properly initialized without a GCMParameterSpec (if there is a default for tLen and its not 128 than the cipher is IMHO not properly initialized).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The other thing is that modes which do not need an AlgorithmParameterSpec (like ECB) are also maybe not properly initialized. Not sure if ECB just ignores the given&#160;IvParameterSpec.&#160; I suggest to just allow null here and if null is given call the cipher.init(mode, key) method without&#160;AlgorithmParameterSpec.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/blob/6b1a6968c68930e970ab4a9c21885e4872318bab/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/crypto/stream/CryptoInputStream.java#L198&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/blob/6b1a6968c68930e970ab4a9c21885e4872318bab/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/crypto/stream/CryptoInputStream.java#L198&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/blob/6b1a6968c68930e970ab4a9c21885e4872318bab/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/crypto/stream/CryptoOutputStream.java#L184&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/blob/6b1a6968c68930e970ab4a9c21885e4872318bab/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/crypto/stream/CryptoOutputStream.java#L184&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Happy to create a PR if bug is confirmed.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13358725">CRYPTO-157</key>
            <summary>Authentication tag length cannot be specified for CryptoInputStream</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>

                            <comment id="17284967" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 15 Feb 2021 22:33:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=salyh&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;salyh&quot;&gt;Hendrik Saly&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

                            <customfieldvalue>9223372036854775807</customfieldvalue>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-149] Intermittent Failure in GCMCipherTest#testGcmTamperedData()</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-149</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Gary Gregory &lt;br/&gt;
Aug 5, 2020, 10:53 PM (20 hours ago)&lt;br/&gt;
to Commons&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Hi All:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am seeing what may be a random AEADBadTagException in GcmCipherTest?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;ERROR&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; testGcmTamperedData(org.apache.commons.crypto.cipher.GcmCipherTest)&lt;br/&gt;
 Time elapsed: 0.015 s  &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; ERROR!&lt;br/&gt;
881java.lang.Exception: Unexpected exception,&lt;br/&gt;
expected&amp;lt;javax.crypto.AEADBadTagException&amp;gt; but&lt;br/&gt;
was&amp;lt;java.lang.InternalError&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
882     at org.apache.commons.crypto.cipher.GcmCipherTest.testGcmTamperedData(GcmCipherTest.java:224)&lt;br/&gt;
883&lt;br/&gt;
884&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Any thoughts?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The above is from&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/commons-crypto/jobs/715348986&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/commons-crypto/jobs/715348986&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Gary&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Alex Remily &lt;br/&gt;
8:10 AM (11 hours ago)&lt;br/&gt;
to Commons&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;That is an intermittent issue that I haven&apos;t been able to reliably reproduce.  As I recall, the test that&apos;s failing is supposed to fail, but in a different way.  I think it&apos;s supposed to fail because of a short buffer but occasionally fails because of an internal error, and when that happens this test fails.  I don&apos;t know when it was introduced.  We should probably document it in jira and or realese notes.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Matt Sicker &lt;br/&gt;
10:33 AM (8 hours ago)&lt;br/&gt;
to Commons&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Now I hope we don&apos;t have unit tests depending on non-static state for&lt;br/&gt;
its random number generator! &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; I&apos;d expect a crypto library&apos;s test&lt;br/&gt;
suites to include several hard-coded known-good and known-bad&lt;br/&gt;
ciphertexts with static keys/IVs similar to the test cases presented&lt;br/&gt;
in their RFCs (especially since said tests are typically small enough&lt;br/&gt;
to copy/paste the binary data fairly easily).&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;#8211;&lt;br/&gt;
Matt Sicker &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Rob Tompkins &lt;br/&gt;
10:37 AM (8 hours ago)&lt;br/&gt;
to Commons&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We actually do have a considerable number of those in our projects where we use probabilistic epsilons on the output. See commons-rng. Note, Gilles is quite good at writing such tests.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;-Rob&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Matt Sicker &lt;br/&gt;
10:42 AM (8 hours ago)&lt;br/&gt;
to Commons&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Well, for testing RNGs, I can understand using property testing, yes.&lt;br/&gt;
It would also be useful for testing fuzzing scenarios like making sure&lt;br/&gt;
the GCM tag is invalid for any random input data (giving a near zero&lt;br/&gt;
probability of valid data) or that an elliptic curve implementation&lt;br/&gt;
doesn&apos;t leak out information about points outside the curve or respond&lt;br/&gt;
to invalid inputs improperly or things like that.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Rob Tompkins &lt;br/&gt;
10:50 AM (8 hours ago)&lt;br/&gt;
to Commons&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;+1 - the elliptic curve stuff I&#8217;ll have to defer to you on as I&#8217;m less a number theorist and more of a logician.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;-Rob&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Gary Gregory  &lt;br/&gt;
10:56 AM (8 hours ago)&lt;br/&gt;
to Commons&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is all fine and good but how would you fix the test such that it does&lt;br/&gt;
not fail randomly. PR anyone?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Gary&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Rob Tompkins &lt;br/&gt;
10:57 AM (8 hours ago)&lt;br/&gt;
to Commons&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Either static inputs for determinism, or putting a probabilistic boundary in which the solution can fall.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;-Rob&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Matt Sicker &lt;br/&gt;
11:00 AM (8 hours ago)&lt;br/&gt;
to Commons&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Choose a seed value for the `new Random()` constructor and the tests&lt;br/&gt;
will be deterministic.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Matt Sicker &lt;br/&gt;
11:02 AM (8 hours ago)&lt;br/&gt;
to Commons&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Or alternatively, if using random values each time, have it retry the&lt;br/&gt;
test with a different value. It&apos;s typically better to use an actual&lt;br/&gt;
property testing library for these types of tests anyways. One example&lt;br/&gt;
library I found is &lt;a href=&quot;https://jqwik.net/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://jqwik.net/&lt;/a&gt; (these types of testing&lt;br/&gt;
libraries are more common in functional programming like in Scala).&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Rob Tompkins &lt;br/&gt;
11:03 AM (8 hours ago)&lt;br/&gt;
to Commons&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Precisely. That&#8217;s another technique we&#8217;ve used in rng.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;-Ropb&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>

                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 6 Aug 2020 23:28:41 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 23 Aug 2020 12:48:32 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 9 Aug 2020 02:24:06 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.0.0</version>
                    <version>1.1.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.1.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Cipher</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="1800">0.5h</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17173726" author="aremily" created="Sun, 9 Aug 2020 02:24:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m fairly confident that this bug is fixed.  The length of the cipher&apos;s initialization vector is set by a call to the Random class&apos;s nextInt method.  The return value for that method was bounded between zero and sixty, inclusive.  When that method returned zero, it resulted in an error setting GCM initial vector length.  I changed the bounds of the return value to between 1 and 60, inclusive, and tested by running the unit test in a continual loop for several minutes without error.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17173727" author="aremily" created="Sun, 9 Aug 2020 02:24:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is the PR with the fix:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/105&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/105&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-144] Illegal reflective access by org.apache.commons.crypto.stream.CryptoInputStream</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-144</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
WARNING: An illegal reflective access operation has occurred
WARNING: Illegal reflective access by org.apache.commons.crypto.stream.CryptoInputStream (&amp;lt;path&amp;gt;/crypt4gh.jar) to method sun.nio.ch.DirectBuffer.cleaner()
WARNING: Please consider reporting &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; to the maintainers of org.apache.commons.crypto.stream.CryptoInputStream
WARNING: Use --illegal-access=warn to enable warnings of further illegal reflective access operations
WARNING: All illegal access operations will be denied in a &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;future&lt;/span&gt; release
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This happens when used on Java 9+. With Java 8 this warning doesn&apos;t seem to occur.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>Ubuntu Xenial, Java 11.0.2 OpenJDK 64-Bit</environment>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-142] Native library does not load if ENGINE_load_rdrand is not available</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-142</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Found this when running tests on Travis:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;java.security.GeneralSecurityException: CryptoRandom: [org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpenSslCryptoRandom] failed with java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpenSslCryptoRandomTest.getCryptoRandom(OpenSslCryptoRandomTest.java:37)

Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpenSslCryptoRandomTest.getCryptoRandom(OpenSslCryptoRandomTest.java:37)

Caused by: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpenSslCryptoRandomTest.getCryptoRandom(OpenSslCryptoRandomTest.java:37)

Caused by: java.security.GeneralSecurityException: Native library could not be initialised

	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpenSslCryptoRandomTest.getCryptoRandom(OpenSslCryptoRandomTest.java:37)

Caused by: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: ENGINE_load_rdrand
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It seems that the OpenSSL library available on the build machine does not have that function. It would be nice to allow the rest of the native code (e.g. the ciphers) to still work in that situation.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13189504">CRYPTO-142</key>
            <summary>Native library does not load if ENGINE_load_rdrand is not available</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="3">Duplicate</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="vanzin">Marcelo Masiero Vanzin</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 4 Oct 2018 17:45:00 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 13 Dec 2018 18:38:02 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 13 Dec 2018 18:38:02 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.0.0</version>
                                                    <component>Native</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16638996" author="vanzin" created="Thu, 4 Oct 2018 22:50:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It seems that things are already reasonably separate, and just the &lt;tt&gt;OpenSslCryptoRandomNative.initSR&lt;/tt&gt; fails in that build image. We could just disable these tests based on some build-time flag so we could have OS X in the CI matrix.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16720474" author="vanzin" created="Thu, 13 Dec 2018 18:37:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is probably because of OpenSSL 1.1 compatibility.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-141] Errors in native code can leave Java wrappers in bad state</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-141</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Currently, the Java side keeps a reference to the address of the EVP context, and checks that it&apos;s not 0 before performing any operations.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But if an error happens in native code, for example here in init():&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (result == 0 &amp;amp;&amp;amp; context != NULL) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (CONTEXT(ctx) != NULL) {
      dlsym_EVP_CIPHER_CTX_cleanup(context);
    } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt; {
      dlsym_EVP_CIPHER_CTX_free(context);
    }
  }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The address known to the Java side will now be invalid, and if any native method is now called the JVM will crash.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13187472">CRYPTO-141</key>
            <summary>Errors in native code can leave Java wrappers in bad state</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="vanzin">Marcelo Masiero Vanzin</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="vanzin">Marcelo Masiero Vanzin</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 26 Sep 2018 00:11:19 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 5 Oct 2018 16:38:23 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 5 Oct 2018 16:38:23 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>1.1.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Native</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16628077" author="vanzin" created="Wed, 26 Sep 2018 00:12:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It might be a better idea to make the cleanup of the native context explicit, so that the Java side can do it when it knows it&apos;s safe.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16629523" author="vanzin" created="Wed, 26 Sep 2018 23:30:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I opened a PR for this:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/80&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/80&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If I find some time I&apos;ll see whether the ASF has any infra for testing this on Win32 and MacOS, since I only have a Linux dev env available.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-138] CipherByteArrayExample fails on openssl 1.1.0g with java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: EVP_CIPHER_CTX_cleanup</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-138</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;running sample code from :&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-crypto/xref-test/org/apache/commons/crypto/examples/CipherByteArrayExample.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-crypto/xref-test/org/apache/commons/crypto/examples/CipherByteArrayExample.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;failed with this error message:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Caused by: java.security.GeneralSecurityException: CryptoCipher {org.apache.commons.crypto.cipher.OpenSslCipher} is not available or transformation AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding is not supported.&lt;br/&gt;

&#160;&#160; &#160;... 11 more&lt;br/&gt;
Caused by: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160; &#160;at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160; &#160;at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:62)&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160; &#160;at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.java:45)&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160; &#160;at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Constructor.java:423)&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160; &#160;at org.apache.commons.crypto.utils.ReflectionUtils.newInstance(ReflectionUtils.java:88)&lt;br/&gt;

Caused by: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: EVP_CIPHER_CTX_cleanup&lt;br/&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Process finished with exit code 1&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;#8212;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;i guess it has something to do with changes of openssl from 1.0 -&amp;gt; 1.1&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26345175/correct-way-to-free-allocate-the-context-in-the-openssl&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26345175/correct-way-to-free-allocate-the-context-in-the-openssl&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

                            <comment id="16516703" author="ossdev07" created="Tue, 19 Jun 2018 06:26:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;there are various APIs of openssl 1.0.x&#160; which are either obsolete or re-defined in 1.1.x.. so for using openssl 1.1.0 needs to replace old APIs with new APIs of openssl 1.1.0&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We have done this activity in commons-crypto&#160; and now its working fine with openssl 1.1.0&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;pull request has been raised waiting to be merged...&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/78&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/78&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;for reference anyone can refer above pull request ..&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16772488" author="vanzin" created="Wed, 20 Feb 2019 00:57:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Should be fixed now:&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-137] Error compiling on Win64 with Mingw</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-137</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Followed steps in &quot;BUILDING.txt&quot; on Windows 10 64-bit but cannot compile native due to inline errors. I see a &quot;Fixed&quot; issue &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-116&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-116&lt;/a&gt; with similar issue, and flag is included in GCC step but does not fix errors.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Below is the GCC log, and the full log for mvn clean test with &quot;-d&quot; flag.&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-135] CryptoOutputStream is always blocking</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-135</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-125&quot; title=&quot;CryptoOutputStream does not call write in a loop when underlying channel works in non-block mode.&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-125&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-125&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; described a bug where not all data written to the CryptoOutputStream would make it to the underlying channel if that channel was non-blocking.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The fix added in that bug makes CryptoOutputStream blocking by doing a busy loop. This makes it a poor match (not to say unusable) for applications that use non-blocking channels, since it will turn non-blocking streams into blocking streams that waste a lot of CPU.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Instead, CryptoOutputStream should correctly implement non-blocking semantics in its implementation of WritableByteChannel.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13043361">CRYPTO-135</key>
            <summary>CryptoOutputStream is always blocking</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="vanzin">Marcelo Masiero Vanzin</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 15 Feb 2017 19:48:09 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 4 Oct 2018 16:23:17 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 4 Oct 2018 16:23:17 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.1.0</version>
                                                    <component>Stream</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15877240" author="dapengsun" created="Wed, 22 Feb 2017 01:46:18 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=vanzin&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;vanzin&quot;&gt;Marcelo Masiero Vanzin&lt;/a&gt; for filing this issue, I think we should fix it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=junjie&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;junjie&quot;&gt;Junjie Chen&lt;/a&gt; Do you have any comments?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15879935" author="junjie" created="Thu, 23 Feb 2017 06:02:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Agree with Marcelo.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We need to fix int write(ByteBuffer src) API to avoid busy loop.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16638468" author="vanzin" created="Thu, 4 Oct 2018 16:23:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;See discussion in the PR for this:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/74&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/74&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Short summary: it&apos;s very hard to provide non-blocking semantics and still return reasonable values to the callers of the WritableByteChannel API. So instead I just commented on the class javadocs that they should only be used with blocking I/O.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-134] CipherByteBufferExample should not truncate the string</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-134</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;CipherByteBufferExample#asString currently truncates the output to 50 bytes.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This was probably a hangover from some debugging, and should be removed.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13042278">CRYPTO-134</key>
            <summary>CipherByteBufferExample should not truncate the string</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="sebb">Sebb</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 11 Feb 2017 12:06:45 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 13 Feb 2017 02:38:56 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 11 Feb 2017 12:18:16 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.0.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.1.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Document</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15862380" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sat, 11 Feb 2017 12:18:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-134&quot; title=&quot;CipherByteBufferExample should not truncate the string&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-134&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-134&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; CipherByteBufferExample should not truncate the string&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Commit: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/9f73f2fc&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/9f73f2fc&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-133] OpenSslCryptoRandomNative.nextRandBytes not thread safe</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-133</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Seems that AbstractRandomTest.testRandomBytesMultiThreaded is failing for OpenSslCryptoRandomNative.nextRandBytes.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Testcase throws exceptions like&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The nextRandBytes method failed
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpenSslCryptoRandom.nextBytes(OpenSslCryptoRandom.java:108)
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.AbstractRandomTest.checkRandomBytes(AbstractRandomTest.java:94)
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.AbstractRandomTest.access$000(AbstractRandomTest.java:30)
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.AbstractRandomTest$1.run(AbstractRandomTest.java:63)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When adding a &apos;synchronized&apos; modifier to OpenSslCryptoRandomNative.nextRandBytes it works.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So IMHO there are two bugs that need to be resolved:&lt;br/&gt;
1) fix testcase AbstractRandomTest.testRandomBytesMultiThreaded in that way that it fails when exception are thrown&lt;br/&gt;
2) fix OpenSslCryptoRandomNative.nextRandBytes no be thread safe (of course not by adding &apos;synchronized&apos;, seems like locks_setup() is broken somehow in &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/blob/master/src/main/native/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpenSslCryptoRandomNative.c#L299&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/blob/master/src/main/native/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpenSslCryptoRandomNative.c#L299&lt;/a&gt; &lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;The testcase can be fixed with something like this&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    @Test(timeout = 120000)
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testRandomBytesMultiThreaded() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; Exception {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; threadCount = 100;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; AtomicBoolean hasErrors = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; AtomicBoolean();
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; CryptoRandom random = getCryptoRandom()) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; List&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Thread&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; threads = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ArrayList&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(threadCount);

            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; i = 0; i &amp;lt; threadCount; i++) {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Thread&lt;/span&gt; t = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Thread&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Runnable&lt;/span&gt;() {
                    @Override
                    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void run() {
                        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
							checkRandomBytes(random, 10);
							checkRandomBytes(random, 1000);
							checkRandomBytes(random, 100000);
						} &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (Exception e) {
							hasErrors.set(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;);
							e.printStackTrace();
						}
                    }
                });
                t.start();
                threads.add(t);
            }

            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Thread&lt;/span&gt; t : threads) {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!t.getState().equals(State.NEW)) {
                    t.join();
                }
            }
            
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt;(hasErrors.get()) {
            	Assert.fail();
            }

        }
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13023526">CRYPTO-133</key>
            <summary>OpenSslCryptoRandomNative.nextRandBytes not thread safe</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="salyh">Hendrik Saly</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 26 Nov 2016 18:04:15 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 13 Apr 2019 19:42:16 +0000</updated>
                                                                                <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>6</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15698291" author="garydgregory" created="Sat, 26 Nov 2016 18:07:14 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Maybe what we need is clear Javadoc on what is thread-safe now. Then we can evolve from there and see if we want to make changes to make some code thread-safe. Otherwise, user&apos;s can just create separate objects for not thread-safe code.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15862121" author="vanzin" created="Sat, 11 Feb 2017 01:25:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hmm... I tried the test changes, I even commented out the code in &quot;pthreads_locking_callback&quot;, and I don&apos;t see a failure. Can you comment more on your env (os, openssl version)?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;My version didn&apos;t even seem to be using the locking functions for this API at all (I upped the thread count to 1000 and even then I only saw a handful of calls to &quot;pthreads_locking_callback&quot;).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Maybe printing out the &quot;ERR_error_string()&quot; from the library when you run the test to see why it&apos;s complaining?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15863642" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 13 Feb 2017 13:15:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If the Javadoc does not state that the code is thread-safe, then no assumptions can be made about thread-safety.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15864362" author="vanzin" created="Mon, 13 Feb 2017 20:25:54 +0000"  >&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;If the Javadoc does not state that the code is thread-safe, then no assumptions can be made about thread-safety.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Fair but, in this case, a little weird, since related APIs like &lt;tt&gt;java.util.Random&lt;/tt&gt; and &lt;tt&gt;java.security.SecureRandom&lt;/tt&gt; are thread-safe. So it&apos;s not really unreasonable to expect this API to be thread-safe too.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15865471" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Tue, 14 Feb 2017 09:39:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I think the best we can do here is to state that the code is not thread-safe.&lt;br/&gt;
This is because we don&apos;t have control of all the code.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The Java code can be made thread-safe; indeed it already is immutable as it has no state.&lt;br/&gt;
I assume the JNI wrapper code can be made thread-safe if it is not already; it should not need to store any state.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However without knowing exactly how OpenSSL is coded, I&apos;m not sure it&apos;s possible to make it thread-safe.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15866192" author="vanzin" created="Tue, 14 Feb 2017 17:29:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;There are hooks to make OpenSSL calls thread safe, and commons-crypto seems to install those hooks (and the code looked fine when I looked at it). But maybe there are issues in some specific environment, which is why I asked for that info; test works fine in my version even with the thread safety hooks removed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Anyway, yes, it&apos;s hard to completely guarantee thread safety when you&apos;re depending on code you do not fully control for that. If there&apos;s some bug in some version of OpenSSL, there&apos;s not much that can be done (aside from making the Java method synchronized).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16817057" author="aremily" created="Sat, 13 Apr 2019 19:42:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I realize this is an old thread, but FWIW I came across this while working on a recent PR.  I only observed this behavior on Windows using OpenSSL 1.0.x.  The Windows build worked fine using OpenSSL 1.1.x.  The Mac and Linux builds worked fine with 1.0.x and 1.1.x.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-132] Instructions in BUILDING.txt don&apos;t work on MacOS</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-132</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When using HomeBrew to link openssl with the --force, HomeBrew refuses to do this, indicating that our docs are not following best practices:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;~/w/a/c/commons-crypto git:(upstream &#9889; CRYPTO-131) 1A &amp;gt; brew link openssl --force
Warning: Refusing to link: openssl
Linking keg-only openssl means you may end up linking against the insecure,
deprecated system OpenSSL &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt; using the headers from Homebrew&apos;s openssl.
Instead, pass the full include/library paths to your compiler e.g.:
  -I/usr/local/opt/openssl/include -L/usr/local/opt/openssl/lib
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Adapt the build so that it is no longer necessary to use link --force on MacOs&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13023489">CRYPTO-132</key>
            <summary>Instructions in BUILDING.txt don&apos;t work on MacOS</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="britter">Benedikt Ritter</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 26 Nov 2016 09:06:53 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 26 Nov 2016 11:57:31 +0000</updated>
                                                                            <component>Build</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15697605" author="britter" created="Sat, 26 Nov 2016 09:11:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;More information on this issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;~/w/a/c/commons-crypto git:(master) &amp;gt; brew info openssl101
homebrew/versions/openssl101: stable 1.0.1u (bottled) [keg-only]
SSL/TLS cryptography library
https:&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//openssl.org
&lt;/span&gt;/usr/local/Cellar/openssl101/1.0.1s (1,281 files, 10.6M)
  Poured from bottle on 2016-05-08 at 14:17:54
/usr/local/Cellar/openssl101/1.0.1t (1,289 files, 10.6M)
  Poured from bottle on 2016-05-09 at 21:10:57
/usr/local/Cellar/openssl101/1.0.1t_1 (1,289 files, 10.6M)
  Poured from bottle on 2016-05-25 at 21:29:23
/usr/local/Cellar/openssl101/1.0.1u (1,293 files, 10.7M)
  Poured from bottle on 2016-10-11 at 16:12:46
From: https:&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-versions/blob/master/openssl101.rb
&lt;/span&gt;==&amp;gt; Dependencies
Build: makedepend &#10004;
==&amp;gt; Options
--universal
	Build a universal binary
--without-test
	Skip build-time tests (not recommended)
==&amp;gt; Caveats
A CA file has been bootstrapped using certificates from the system
keychain. To add additional certificates, place .pem files in
  /usr/local/etc/openssl/certs

and run
  /usr/local/opt/openssl101/bin/c_rehash

This formula is keg-only, which means it was not symlinked into /usr/local.

Apple has deprecated use of OpenSSL in favor of its own TLS and crypto libraries

Generally there are no consequences of &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; you. If you build your
own software and it requires &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; formula, you&apos;ll need to add to your
build variables:

    LDFLAGS:  -L/usr/local/opt/openssl101/lib
    CPPFLAGS: -I/usr/local/opt/openssl101/include
    PKG_CONFIG_PATH: /usr/local/opt/openssl101/lib/pkgconfig
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15697811" author="britter" created="Sat, 26 Nov 2016 11:57:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve changed Makefile.common like so:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;diff --git a/Makefile.common b/Makefile.common
index 0f50098..df44fe8 100644
--- a/Makefile.common
+++ b/Makefile.common
@@ -172,18 +172,18 @@ Linux-armhf_COMMONS_CRYPTO_FLAGS:=
 Mac-x86_CC        := gcc -arch i386
 Mac-x86_CXX       := g++ -arch i386
 Mac-x86_STRIP     := strip -x
-Mac-x86_CFLAGS    := -Ilib/inc_mac -I$(JAVA_HOME)/include -O2 -fPIC -mmacosx-version-min=10.4 -fvisibility=hidden -I/usr/local/include
-Mac-x86_CXXFLAGS  := -Ilib/inc_mac -I$(JAVA_HOME)/include -O2 -fPIC -mmacosx-version-min=10.4 -fvisibility=hidden -I/usr/local/include
-Mac-x86_LINKFLAGS := -dynamiclib -&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt;-libgcc -L/usr/local/lib
+Mac-x86_CFLAGS    := -Ilib/inc_mac -I$(JAVA_HOME)/include -O2 -fPIC -mmacosx-version-min=10.4 -fvisibility=hidden -I/usr/local/opt/openssl101/include
+Mac-x86_CXXFLAGS  := -Ilib/inc_mac -I$(JAVA_HOME)/include -O2 -fPIC -mmacosx-version-min=10.4 -fvisibility=hidden -I/usr/local/opt/openssl101/include
+Mac-x86_LINKFLAGS := -dynamiclib -&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt;-libgcc -L/usr/local/opt/openssl101/lib
 Mac-x86_LIBNAME   := libcommons-crypto.jnilib
 Mac-x86_COMMONS_CRYPTO_FLAGS  :=
 
 Mac-x86_64_CC        := gcc -arch $(OS_ARCH)
 Mac-x86_64_CXX       := g++ -arch $(OS_ARCH)
 Mac-x86_64_STRIP     := strip -x
-Mac-x86_64_CFLAGS    := -Ilib/inc_mac -I$(JAVA_HOME)/include -O2 -fPIC -mmacosx-version-min=10.5 -fvisibility=hidden -I/usr/local/include
-Mac-x86_64_CXXFLAGS  := -Ilib/inc_mac -I$(JAVA_HOME)/include -O2 -fPIC -mmacosx-version-min=10.5 -fvisibility=hidden -I/usr/local/include
-Mac-x86_64_LINKFLAGS := -dynamiclib -L/usr/local/lib
+Mac-x86_64_CFLAGS    := -Ilib/inc_mac -I$(JAVA_HOME)/include -O2 -fPIC -mmacosx-version-min=10.5 -fvisibility=hidden -I/usr/local/opt/openssl101/include
+Mac-x86_64_CXXFLAGS  := -Ilib/inc_mac -I$(JAVA_HOME)/include -O2 -fPIC -mmacosx-version-min=10.5 -fvisibility=hidden -I/usr/local/opt/openssl101/include
+Mac-x86_64_LINKFLAGS := -dynamiclib -L/usr/local/opt/openssl101/lib
 Mac-x86_64_LIBNAME   := libcommons-crypto.jnilib
 Mac-x86_64_COMMONS_CRYPTO_FLAGS  :=
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;With this changes, the native build works again. However the tests are now failing with errors like this: &lt;tt&gt;java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Cannot find AES-CTR support, is your version of Openssl new enough?&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Running the main method of the &lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.crypto.Crypto&lt;/tt&gt; class for diagnostics results in the following:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;Apache Commons Crypto 1.1.0-SNAPSHOT
Native code loaded OK 1.1.0-SNAPSHOT
Native Name Apache Commons Crypto
Native Built Nov 26 2016
OpenSSL library loaded OK, version: 0x9081df
OpenSSL 0.9.8zh 14 Jan 2016
Exception in thread &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;main&quot;&lt;/span&gt; java.security.GeneralSecurityException: CryptoRandom: [org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpenSslCryptoRandom] failed with java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.CryptoRandomFactory.getCryptoRandom(CryptoRandomFactory.java:217)
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.Crypto.main(Crypto.java:140)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
	at com.intellij.rt.execution.application.AppMain.main(AppMain.java:147)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.utils.ReflectionUtils.newInstance(ReflectionUtils.java:90)
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.CryptoRandomFactory.getCryptoRandom(CryptoRandomFactory.java:198)
	... 6 more
Caused by: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:57)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.java:45)
	at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Constructor.java:526)
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.utils.ReflectionUtils.newInstance(ReflectionUtils.java:88)
	... 7 more
Caused by: java.security.GeneralSecurityException: Native library could not be initialised
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpenSslCryptoRandom.&amp;lt;init&amp;gt;(OpenSslCryptoRandom.java:88)
	... 12 more
Caused by: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: ENGINE_load_rdrand
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpenSslCryptoRandomNative.initSR(Native Method)
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpenSslCryptoRandom.&amp;lt;clinit&amp;gt;(OpenSslCryptoRandom.java:56)
	at java.lang.&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;.forName0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;.forName(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;.java:274)
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.utils.ReflectionUtils.getClassByNameOrNull(ReflectionUtils.java:138)
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.utils.ReflectionUtils.getClassByName(ReflectionUtils.java:103)
	at org.apache.commons.crypto.random.CryptoRandomFactory.getCryptoRandom(CryptoRandomFactory.java:197)
	... 6 more
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So the native libraries have been compiled against OpenSSL 0.9.8zh, which is shipped with MacOS. To find out whether the build is falling back to the System OpenSSL, I removed the &lt;tt&gt;-I&lt;/tt&gt; and &lt;tt&gt;-L&lt;/tt&gt; flags for OpenSSL from Makefile.common. Now the build native build is failing, which indicates to me, that the flags are needed by the compiler (there does not seem to be a fallback without passing those flags). I&apos;m puzzled, since the build configuration seems to be correct, but it pulls in OpenSSL 0.9.8 nevertheless.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

            <title>[CRYPTO-129] Change access of instance variables from package private to private (or protected if appropriate)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-129</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Change access of instance variables from package private to private (or protected if appropriate).&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13019151">CRYPTO-129</key>
            <summary>Change access of instance variables from package private to private (or protected if appropriate)</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>

                            <comment id="15862095" author="vanzin" created="Sat, 11 Feb 2017 00:51:04 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Looks fixed?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/commit/dc1769ed66b762646cdc7d2f5b268f274485f6b3&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/commit/dc1769ed66b762646cdc7d2f5b268f274485f6b3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15863127" author="dapengsun" created="Mon, 13 Feb 2017 02:29:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=vanzin&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;vanzin&quot;&gt;Marcelo Masiero Vanzin&lt;/a&gt;, it have been committed to master, do you have any idea?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15863568" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 13 Feb 2017 12:23:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Protected fields should be avoided if possible.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Once exposed as part of the API, that constrains future development.&lt;br/&gt;
For example, if a protected field needs to be changed from an int to a long, that cannot be done without breaking the API.&lt;br/&gt;
Or if the code is changed and no longer needs the field, it still has to be maintained or the functionality may be broken.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And protected mutable fields should never be used in new code.&lt;br/&gt;
It&apos;s impossible to ensure thread-safety if there are any exposed mutable fields.&lt;br/&gt;
So for example only empty arrays can ever be safely exposed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Only constants should be exposed, and only if they really are constants that will never change. Otherwise one can run into problems with constant embedding - the Java compiler can take copies of constants from one class to another.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15863582" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 13 Feb 2017 12:32:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;See &lt;a href=&quot;https://wiki.apache.org/commons/CodeStyle&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://wiki.apache.org/commons/CodeStyle&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15865374" author="dapengsun" created="Tue, 14 Feb 2017 08:45:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=vanzin&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;vanzin&quot;&gt;Marcelo Masiero Vanzin&lt;/a&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~sebb@apache.org&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, I&apos;m agreed we should fix it.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15868637" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 15 Feb 2017 21:53:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Note: if instance variables can be made private instead of package protected, obviously that is a good idea.&lt;br/&gt;
In this case that only applies to some of the test classes&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15868648" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 15 Feb 2017 22:02:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-129&quot; title=&quot;Change access of instance variables from package private to private (or protected if appropriate)&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-129&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-129&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; Revert unnecessary exposure of instance variables&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Commit: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/c24b691a&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/c24b691a&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Tree: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/c24b691a&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/c24b691a&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Diff: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/diff/c24b691a&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/diff/c24b691a&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-128] Make constructors of CryptoOutputStream and CryptoInputStream are public</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-128</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;for better integrate with Hadoop HDFS, it is better to Make constructors of CryptoOutputStream and CryptoInputStream are public&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13016797">CRYPTO-128</key>
            <summary>Make constructors of CryptoOutputStream and CryptoInputStream are public</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-125] CryptoOutputStream does not call write in a loop when underlying channel works in non-block mode.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-125</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The encrypt function call output.write without loop which lead to data loss when creating the output encryption stream with a SocketChannel and works in non-block mode.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As suggested, it should be call as following way:&lt;br/&gt;
while(buf.hasRemaining()) {&lt;br/&gt;
    channel.write(buf);&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13012752">CRYPTO-125</key>
            <summary>CryptoOutputStream does not call write in a loop when underlying channel works in non-block mode.</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="junjie">Junjie Chen</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="junjie">Junjie Chen</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 17 Oct 2016 03:32:17 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 15 Feb 2017 19:48:25 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 26 Oct 2016 08:05:18 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.0.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.1.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Stream</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>4</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15607810" author="dapengsun" created="Wed, 26 Oct 2016 08:05:18 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank Junjie for the contribution.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Repository: commons-crypto&lt;br/&gt;
Updated Branches:&lt;br/&gt;
  refs/heads/master 77af2da3d -&amp;gt; 3adc20723&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-125&quot; title=&quot;CryptoOutputStream does not call write in a loop when underlying channel works in non-block mode.&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-125&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-125&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: CryptoOutputStream does not call write in a loop when underlying channel works in non-block mode. (Reviewed by Sun, Dapeng and Ke, Xianda)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Closes #71 from cjjnjust:master&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Commit: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/3adc2072&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/3adc2072&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Tree: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/3adc2072&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/3adc2072&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Diff: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/diff/3adc2072&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/diff/3adc2072&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Branch: refs/heads/master&lt;br/&gt;
Commit: 3adc20723b823bad58a39f7952300538450d3b7c&lt;br/&gt;
Parents: 77af2da&lt;br/&gt;
Author: Junjie Chen &amp;lt;junjie.j.chen@intel.com&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Authored: Mon Oct 24 10:11:29 2016 +0800&lt;br/&gt;
Committer: Sun Dapeng &amp;lt;sdp@apache.org&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Committed: Mon Oct 24 10:12:29 2016 +0800&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15864349" author="vanzin" created="Mon, 13 Feb 2017 20:18:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi there,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t think this fix is correct. The issue here is that &lt;tt&gt;CryptoOutputStream&lt;/tt&gt; is not really following the API defined by &lt;tt&gt;WritableByteChannel&lt;/tt&gt;. That API allows the channel to write less data than available in the input buffer (and the calling code needs to be able to handle that situation). That&apos;s required for non-blocking I/O.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This change will cause really high CPU usage if the underlying channel is non-blocking and is not ready for write, and will undesirably block I/O threads in that situation (e.g., instead of giving control back to the application so it can write to other channels that are ready, it will go into a busy loop until this one output channel becomes ready).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15868465" author="vanzin" created="Wed, 15 Feb 2017 19:48:25 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I filed &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-135&quot; title=&quot;CryptoOutputStream is always blocking&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-135&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-135&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; to track fixing that issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-123] Clean CRYPTO build script</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-123</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Currently, some build scripts are out of time, like the part of building on IBM JDK, the latest IBM JDK have fixed the jni issue, we should clean the script&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13001534">CRYPTO-123</key>
            <summary>Clean CRYPTO build script</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-114] exception.c/exception.h are not used</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-114</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Looks like exception.c/.h are not actually used.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;They don&apos;t appear to be compiled by the Makefile, and I cannot find any references to the methods in the main native sources.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also the terror(int) method does not look like it would work on Windows anyway.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Both MacOSX and Windows build and test OK without the files.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-113] Improve error reporting by factories</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-113</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The Cipher and Random factories currently return errors as the text of the exception.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This means a lot of the context is lost, particularly the cause of any Reflection failures. It would be useful to return the last known exception as the cause.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This would allow further analysis of actual error.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12988075">CRYPTO-113</key>
            <summary>Improve error reporting by factories</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-109] Move Openssl JNA to feature branch</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-109</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;JNA is an important feature.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Since it have some bugs like causing JVM crash, the target of JNA should be next release(after 1.0.0). We should move the related code to feature branch currently.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If JNA feature is strong demanded, we can speed up the progress of merging JNA feature branch to master and make another release.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12987092">CRYPTO-109</key>
            <summary>Move Openssl JNA to feature branch</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="dapengsun">Dapeng Sun</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="dapengsun">Dapeng Sun</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 6 Jul 2016 09:03:41 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 7 Jul 2016 08:19:22 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 7 Jul 2016 08:19:22 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15364022" author="dapengsun" created="Wed, 6 Jul 2016 09:05:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~sebb@apache.org&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, I will start to move the code if you agreed, do you have any comments? &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15364083" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 6 Jul 2016 10:10:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s easy enough to avoid the JVM crash. However the obvious fix entails not deallocating the context.&lt;br/&gt;
If this is acceptable, then I would prefer to leave the code in place so we can potentially get some feedback.&lt;br/&gt;
The implementation is not currently included in the factory enums, and is not a default, so users have to specifically request it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The first release will be at most a beta release as the JNI code does not build on Windows (and possibly other systems), so I don&apos;t see the harm provided it is made clear that the JNA implementation is alpha quality.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15365800" author="dapengsun" created="Thu, 7 Jul 2016 08:19:04 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank Sebb for your comments.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The implementation is not currently included in the factory enums, and is not a default, so users have to specifically request it.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The reason sound good to me.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
