<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-108] OpenSSL does not handle Native code loading failure</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-108</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;OpenSSL fails to check if the Native code was loaded successfully before creating an instance.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This just defers the inevitable failure; it would be better to throw an error immediately.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also the code should provide the details of the load faiure&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12986982">CRYPTO-108</key>
            <summary>OpenSSL does not handle Native code loading failure</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="sebb">Sebb</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 5 Jul 2016 22:40:32 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 11 Jul 2016 08:19:00 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 6 Jul 2016 23:57:02 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>1.0.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15363906" author="kexianda" created="Wed, 6 Jul 2016 07:30:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~sebb@apache.org&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;br/&gt;
Currently, OpenSSL doesn&apos;t throw exception. the native is loaded in a static block.&lt;br/&gt;
Class initializers are executed in the order they are defined, if we throw exception when loading native in the static block. we are trying to use a class that is in an erroneous state.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;if any loading failure, OpenSslCipher.java will handle it and throw an exception.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;OpenSslCipher(Properties props, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; transformation) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//...
&lt;/span&gt;        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; loadingFailureReason = OpenSsl.getLoadingFailureReason();
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (loadingFailureReason != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; RuntimeException(loadingFailureReason);
        }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="15363962" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 6 Jul 2016 08:26:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;That&apos;s not what I meant. The static block currently does:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; loadingFailure = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (Crypto.isNativeCodeLoaded()) {
            OpenSslNative.initIDs();
        }
    } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (Exception t) {
        loadingFailure = t.getMessage();
    } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;finally&lt;/span&gt; {
        loadingFailureReason = loadingFailure;
    }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note that it ignores the condition isNativeLoaded == false, so OpenSslCipher won&apos;t see the error&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think it should be:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; loadingFailure = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (Crypto.isNativeCodeLoaded()) {
            OpenSslNative.initIDs();
        } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt; {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Throwable cannot be &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; isNativeCodeLoaded is &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/span&gt;            loadingFailure = Crypto.getLoadingError().getMessage();
        }
    } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (Exception t) {
        loadingFailure = t.getMessage();
    } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;finally&lt;/span&gt; {
        loadingFailureReason = loadingFailure;
    }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;About throwing an error: I meant the class as a whole should throw the error, not the static block.&lt;br/&gt;
e.g. in getInstance()&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But at the least the static block should handle native load failure and update the failure reason.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15365242" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 6 Jul 2016 22:23:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-108&quot; title=&quot;OpenSSL does not handle Native code loading failure&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-108&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-108&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; OpenSSL does not handle Native code loading failure&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Save load failure message, so getLoadingFailureReason == null means code&lt;br/&gt;
loaded and init OK&lt;br/&gt;
TODO prevent instantiation if init not done OK&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Commit: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/079c1589&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/079c1589&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Tree: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/079c1589&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/079c1589&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Diff: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/diff/079c1589&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/diff/079c1589&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15365354" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 6 Jul 2016 23:57:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-108&quot; title=&quot;OpenSSL does not handle Native code loading failure&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-108&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-108&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; OpenSSL does not handle Native code loading failure&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Don&apos;t construct class if it won&apos;t work&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Commit: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/edbdf918&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/edbdf918&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Tree: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/edbdf918&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/edbdf918&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Diff: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/diff/edbdf918&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/diff/edbdf918&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-107] NativeCodeLoader fails to handle UnsatisfiedLinkError</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-107</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;UnsatisfiedLinkError can be returned by System.loadLibrary and System.load.&lt;br/&gt;
The code needs to catch this.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It would also be useful to save the exception and provide a means to access it when loading fails.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s also rather difficult to unit test the code as the class can only be loaded once per run. Moving the bulk of the static block code into a package-protected method would help here.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12986960">CRYPTO-107</key>
            <summary>NativeCodeLoader fails to handle UnsatisfiedLinkError</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="sebb">Sebb</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 5 Jul 2016 21:37:06 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 6 Jul 2016 05:50:08 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 5 Jul 2016 22:31:33 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>1.0.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15363394" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Tue, 5 Jul 2016 22:31:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-107&quot; title=&quot;NativeCodeLoader fails to handle UnsatisfiedLinkError&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-107&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-107&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; NativeCodeLoader fails to handle UnsatisfiedLinkError&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Catch UnsatisfiedLinkError&lt;br/&gt;
Save the cause on loading error&lt;br/&gt;
Add unit tests&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Commit: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/b1d66b82&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/b1d66b82&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Tree: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/b1d66b82&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/b1d66b82&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Diff: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/diff/b1d66b82&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/diff/b1d66b82&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-106] CryptoRandomFactory only handles ClassCast and ClassNotFound</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-106</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The RandomFactory getCryptoRandom method only handles ClassCast and ClassNotFound.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It ought to handle all other exceptions as per the corresponding CipherFactory.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12986871">CRYPTO-106</key>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-103] NativeCodeLoader.getVersion() is not needed</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-103</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The NativeCodeLoader.getVersion() method seems badly named, as it has nothing to do with the native code that has been loaded.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It only relates to the version of the Java code in the jar.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I would expect the method to return the version details from the library itself.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If there is a need to return the Java code version, it should be done from a method in another class, e.g. Utils or Crypto. Note: also the extraction should be done once, e.g. using IODH or using a synchronised/volatile lock.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12986593">CRYPTO-103</key>
            <summary>NativeCodeLoader.getVersion() is not needed</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="dapengsun">Dapeng Sun</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 4 Jul 2016 12:52:54 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 11 Jul 2016 08:19:30 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 9 Jul 2016 12:22:49 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>1.0.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15365869" author="dapengsun" created="Thu, 7 Jul 2016 09:28:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank Sebb, since the version is only used at loading native. I prefer to change method name to getCryptoVersion and remove the Crypto#getVersion(). &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt; also the extraction should be done once, e.g. using IODH or using a synchronised/volatile lock.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In fact, the method is called at static block and it is limited for outside, I don&apos;t think we need to add a lock.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Do you have any comment?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15367167" author="dapengsun" created="Fri, 8 Jul 2016 03:33:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Related PR : &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/69&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/69&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15367423" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 8 Jul 2016 09:06:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I was forgetting that the version is also used to load the library.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But I think the method does not belong in NativeCodeLoader.&lt;br/&gt;
Also it would be useful to have that info available (&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-104&quot; title=&quot;Native code should provide getVersion() methods&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-104&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-104&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A better solution might be to put the code into the Crypto class &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/star_yellow.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; and then use it from the NativeCodeLoader.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/star_yellow.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; using a less ambiguous name, e.g. getComponentVersion()&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15368636" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 8 Jul 2016 22:55:07 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Looking into it further, I don&apos;t think the NativeCodeLoader.getVersion() method is actually needed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s only used as part of the name of a temporary file which is deleted on exit.&lt;br/&gt;
The file name also contains a random UUID.&lt;br/&gt;
The version does not appear to offer any benefit at all.&lt;br/&gt;
It does not help make the name unique (since it will be constant for a given version of Crypto) and there is no need to identify the file by its version (tests still work if the version is &apos;unknown&apos;). And the file is deleted after use.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think the code should be removed along with Crypto.getVersion().&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;At some later stage new version methods can be added as per &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-104&quot; title=&quot;Native code should provide getVersion() methods&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-104&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-104&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, but this implementation is not needed.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15369072" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sat, 9 Jul 2016 12:22:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-103&quot; title=&quot;NativeCodeLoader.getVersion() is not needed&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-103&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-103&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; NativeCodeLoader.getVersion() is not needed&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Commit: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/fd2b9347&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/fd2b9347&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-102] Makefile.common defines JAVA/JAVAH/JAVAC incorrectly for Windows</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-102</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Makefile.common defines the following:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;JAVA  := &quot;$$JAVA_HOME/bin/java&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
JAVAC := &quot;$$JAVA_HOME/bin/javac&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
JAVAH := &quot;$$JAVA_HOME/bin/javah&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This results in the the following being used at run-time:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&quot;$JAVA_HOME/bin/java&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
etc&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is OK for shells that support $NAME as a variable reference; Windows for one does not.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The variables should be resolved at definition time.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12986428">CRYPTO-102</key>
            <summary>Makefile.common defines JAVA/JAVAH/JAVAC incorrectly for Windows</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="sebb">Sebb</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 2 Jul 2016 18:33:07 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 6 Jul 2016 05:51:02 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 2 Jul 2016 18:45:39 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>1.0.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-99] Makefile clean removes too much</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-99</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The clean target currently consist of:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;clean:
	rm -rf $(TARGET)
	rm -rf $(COMMONS_CRYPTO_OUT)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This removes some input files that it needs and anyway COMMONS_CRYPTO_OUT is under TARGET&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It should only drop the files it actually creates.&lt;br/&gt;
For example:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;clean:
	rm -rf $(TARGET)/jni-classes
	rm -rf $(COMMONS_CRYPTO_OUT)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12986422">CRYPTO-99</key>
            <summary>Makefile clean removes too much</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-97] Code uses System.err/System.out</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-97</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;There are several instances where the code writes to System.err or System.out&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is not generally useful in library code.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A better way needs to be found to report the information, if it is actually needed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Locations are:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;org/apache/commons/crypto/NativeCodeLoader.java&lt;br/&gt;
197:            e.printStackTrace(System.err);&lt;br/&gt;
229:            System.err.println(e);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;org/apache/commons/crypto/utils/Utils.java&lt;br/&gt;
76:            System.err.println(&quot;Could not load &apos;&quot;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12986415">CRYPTO-97</key>
            <summary>Code uses System.err/System.out</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="dapengsun">Dapeng Sun</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 2 Jul 2016 15:39:38 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 6 Jul 2016 05:49:19 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 4 Jul 2016 12:03:14 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>1.0.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15361078" author="dapengsun" created="Mon, 4 Jul 2016 09:26:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Sebb, I think we can remove these information&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15361079" author="dapengsun" created="Mon, 4 Jul 2016 09:28:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;PR is &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/67&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/67&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15361219" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 4 Jul 2016 12:03:14 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-97&quot; title=&quot;Code uses System.err/System.out&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-97&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-97&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; Code uses System.err/System.out&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Fixes #67&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-96] OpenSSL Random implementation silently falls back to Java</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-96</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The OpensslRandom class silently falls back to using the Java implementation if the native code is loaded but the nextRandBytes method fails.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This seems wrong as it can cause unexpected results and mask problems.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The corresponding OpensslCipher class does not fall back to JCE.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12985756">CRYPTO-96</key>
            <summary>OpenSSL Random implementation silently falls back to Java</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-95] Code should never catch Throwable</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-95</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;As a general rule, code should never catch Throwable or Error, only Exception.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Sometimes it is necessary to catch more than just Exception, but if so, the code must be careful to rethrow certain errors, e.g.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;ThreadDeath&lt;br/&gt;
VirtualMachineError&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There may be some others&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If the throwable is not logged, then it&apos;s vital to ensure that only the appropriate ones are swallowed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But it is better to be explicit and only catch errors which are safe to handle.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12985722">CRYPTO-95</key>
            <summary>Code should never catch Throwable</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="sebb">Sebb</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 30 Jun 2016 11:28:41 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 6 Jul 2016 05:51:42 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 30 Jun 2016 11:43:27 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>1.0.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>

&lt;p&gt;Replaced with Exception&lt;/p&gt;

                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-94</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Consistently camel-case type names, even for acronyms.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example: XmlSaxThing, OpenSslThing, OsThing.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12985655">CRYPTO-94</key>
            <summary>Consistently camel-case type names</summary>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-93] add a factory method to provide simpler API</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-93</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Add a default factory method to provide simpler API and better hardware  random.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;OpensslCryptoRandom uses hardware random  number generator if  hardware supports.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Hardware random number generators are almost always better to use than a software based generator. Hardware generators are often called True Random Number generators (TRNG) or Non-Deterministic Random Number Generators since they don&apos;t rely on the deterministic behavior of executing software instructions. Their bits streams are nearly always indistinguishable from random streams, and their entropy is always nearly 100%.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Modern Intel CPUs(3rd generation Core i5 or i7 processor (Ivy Bridge) or above) do support  random  number generator, it is better to provide a default API(openssl implementation) for the client user.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// By &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;default&lt;/span&gt;, use True Random &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Number&lt;/span&gt; Generator (hardware random)
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Simpler API. client code is clean.
&lt;/span&gt;CryptoRandom random = CryptoRandomFactory.getCryptoRandom();
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[] key = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[16];
random.nextBytes(key);
random.close();
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12984803">CRYPTO-93</key>
            <summary>add a factory method to provide simpler API</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="kexianda">Xianda Ke</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="kexianda">Xianda Ke</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 29 Jun 2016 08:14:43 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 30 Jun 2016 19:43:17 +0000</updated>

                            <comment id="15354786" author="kexianda" created="Wed, 29 Jun 2016 08:30:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub PR: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/63&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/63&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15357730" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 30 Jun 2016 19:43:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-93&quot; title=&quot;add a factory method to provide simpler API&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-93&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-93&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; add a factory method to provide simpler API&lt;/p&gt;

factory. This will try to create the OPENSSL cipher and fall back to the&lt;br/&gt;
JAVA one.&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-90] Utils loads system properties during class loading</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-90</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The Utils class reads properties from a properties file if it exists, and adds them to the set of System properties.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There are several problems with this:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;there&apos;s no way of knowing exactly when the properties will be processed, because it depends when the Utils class is first used&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;generally it&apos;s a bad idea to update System properties.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;updates to System properties require additional privileges, so the behaviour of the code will depend on the environment in which it is run.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;the code catches Throwable, which is not allowed.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;If there is a use case for supporting a properties file, it should be processed at a predictable stage in the code, should be done before command-line parameters are processed, and should not require updating System properties.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12982708">CRYPTO-90</key>
            <summary>Utils loads system properties during class loading</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="dapengsun">Dapeng Sun</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 24 Jun 2016 14:38:39 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 6 Jul 2016 05:56:33 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 29 Jun 2016 22:53:43 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>1.0.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15352891" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Tue, 28 Jun 2016 12:12:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;An alternative approach would be to add a method to return a local Properties instance.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example (pseudocode):&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; Properties getDefaultProperties() {
    Properties props = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Properties(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.getProperties()); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;default&lt;/span&gt; to system
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (prop in ConfigurationKeys.SYSTEM_PROPERTIES_FILE) { &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// pseudo-code
&lt;/span&gt;        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.getProperty(prop.name()) == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) { &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// add local prop &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; not defined by system
&lt;/span&gt;            props.addProperty(prop);
        }
    }
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; props;
}
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; getProperties() {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Properties(getDefaultProperties()); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// protect the defaults against change
&lt;/span&gt;}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This would allow arbitrary properties to be defined in the Properties instance without needing to change any SystemProperties.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note: the defaults processing could be done once by using the IODH idiom&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15354992" author="dapengsun" created="Wed, 29 Jun 2016 10:22:14 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank Sebb, &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/65&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/65&lt;/a&gt; is created for this issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

                            <comment id="15362298" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Tue, 5 Jul 2016 09:50:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-90&quot; title=&quot;Utils loads system properties during class loading&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-90&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-90&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; Utils loads system properties during class loading&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-89] more robust native code to eliminate memory leak</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-89</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;currently, when handling error in the native code, some resource allocated is not deallocated.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    input_bytes = (unsigned &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;char&lt;/span&gt; *) (*env)-&amp;gt;GetByteArrayElements(env, input, 0);  &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//in some &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;case&lt;/span&gt;, it is not deallocated&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;the byte array may accupy lots of memory.  this can cause serious memory leak in the long-running server&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12982194">CRYPTO-89</key>
            <summary>more robust native code to eliminate memory leak</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="kexianda">Xianda Ke</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="kexianda">Xianda Ke</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 23 Jun 2016 03:35:20 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 29 Jun 2016 05:54:33 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 29 Jun 2016 05:54:33 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15345754" author="kexianda" created="Thu, 23 Jun 2016 05:13:05 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;C doesn&apos;t support exceptions, try-finally blocks, or RAII at all. A typical approach is to separate releasing of resources at the end of the function and jump there with gotos in the case of error. This way the cleanup code need not be duplicated.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15345950" author="kexianda" created="Thu, 23 Jun 2016 07:20:55 +0000"  >&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;OpensslNative.c&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Java_org_apache_commons_crypto_cipher_OpensslNative_init () {

  &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// ugly &amp;amp; hard to be understood
&lt;/span&gt;  &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; 0, the context pointer will be reset as NULL, and the context has not change to be deallocated. 
&lt;/span&gt;  &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// memory leak!
&lt;/span&gt;  jbyte *jIv = (*env)-&amp;gt;GetByteArrayElements(env, iv, NULL);
  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (jIv == NULL) {
    (*env)-&amp;gt;ReleaseByteArrayElements(env, key, jKey, 0);
    THROW(env, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;java/lang/InternalError&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Cannot get bytes array &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; iv.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; (jlong)0;
  }

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// potential memory leak! 
&lt;/span&gt;   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!(alg == AES_CTR || alg == AES_CBC)) {
    THROW(env, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;java/security/NoSuchAlgorithmException&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;The algorithm is not supported.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; (jlong)0;
  }

  &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Error is not handled
&lt;/span&gt;  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (padding == NOPADDING) {
    dlsym_EVP_CIPHER_CTX_set_padding(context, 0);
  } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (padding == PKCS5PADDING) {
    dlsym_EVP_CIPHER_CTX_set_padding(context, 1);
  }
}
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//...&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15345989" author="kexianda" created="Thu, 23 Jun 2016 07:45:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub PR: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/62&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/62&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15354605" author="dapengsun" created="Wed, 29 Jun 2016 05:54:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank Xianda.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-89&quot; title=&quot;more robust native code to eliminate memory leak&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-89&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-89&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: more robust native code to eliminate memory leak&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-86] What purpose does the Properties instance serve?</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-86</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The CrytoCipher implementations currently store a reference to a Properties instance.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However it does not appear to be used by the class except to create a new instance of the class.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It looks like the field could be dropped entirely.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12980568">CRYPTO-86</key>
            <summary>What purpose does the Properties instance serve?</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="kexianda">Xianda Ke</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 18 Jun 2016 15:54:58 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 24 Jun 2016 05:25:04 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 24 Jun 2016 05:25:04 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15341292" author="kexianda" created="Tue, 21 Jun 2016 07:29:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Properties instance was used only in PositionedCryptoInputStream.getCipherState().&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;                cipher = CryptoCipherFactory.getInstance(getCipher()
                        .getTransformation(), getCipher().getProperties());
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;agree with &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~sebb@apache.org&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;. Since PositionedCryptoInputStream itself has Properties parameters, there is no need to hold the Properties reference in CryptoCipher.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;GitHub PR: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/57&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/57&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15341472" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Tue, 21 Jun 2016 09:57:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Also I wonder whether a Properties instance is the best way to pass in the configuration parameters.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s awkward to use compared with separate parameters which can use the natural type: String, boolean, enum as appropriate.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Or perhaps a config class that contains the settings?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15347740" author="dapengsun" created="Fri, 24 Jun 2016 05:25:04 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Add  commit message.&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-86&quot; title=&quot;What purpose does the Properties instance serve?&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-86&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-86&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; remove the Properties field in CryptoCipher&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Commit: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/4bbb57a0&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/4bbb57a0&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-85] CryptoCipher ENCRYPT_MODE and DECRYPT_MODE are unnecessary and confusing</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-85</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The CryptoCipher.ENCRYPT_MODE and DECRYPT_MODE constants don&apos;t seem to serve any purpose.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;They should be dropped and the javax.crypto.Cipher constants used instead.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Alternatively, replace them with an enum, which would allow the compiler to check the values.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note: the values currently have to be checked by both JceCipher and OpensslCipher. Since JceCipher uses the Cipher constant that check would disappear if the CryptoCipher constant were dropped.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12980560">CRYPTO-85</key>
            <summary>CryptoCipher ENCRYPT_MODE and DECRYPT_MODE are unnecessary and confusing</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="dapengsun">Dapeng Sun</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 18 Jun 2016 14:22:55 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 21 Jun 2016 10:14:44 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 21 Jun 2016 03:01:22 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-84] Utils.getJCEProvider belongs in JceCipher class</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-84</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;getJCEProvider is only needed by the JceCipher class.&lt;br/&gt;
It&apos;s confusing to have it in a shared class.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12980232">CRYPTO-84</key>
            <summary>Utils.getJCEProvider belongs in JceCipher class</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>

&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-83] Utils.getRandomDevPath should be private method in OsCryptoRandom</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-83</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The method Utils.getRandomDevPath is only used from OsCryptoRandom and should probably be moved there.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Likewise the default value constant&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;COMMONS_CRYPTO_SECURE_RANDOM_DEVICE_FILE_PATH_DEFAULT&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;does not really make much sense except to the OsCryptoRandom class.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note: property key names do need to be centrally defined to avoid duplication.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12979899">CRYPTO-83</key>
            <summary>Utils.getRandomDevPath should be private method in OsCryptoRandom</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-82] CipherTransformation is an enum which limits the possible transformations</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-82</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The class CipherTransformation is an enum with only 3 entries currently.&lt;br/&gt;
This seems wrong; surely there are many more possible transformations?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;An enum should generally only be used to denote a limited and known set of choices. Otherwise users are limited to whatever was made available when the code was released.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12979878">CRYPTO-82</key>
            <summary>CipherTransformation is an enum which limits the possible transformations</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="kexianda">Xianda Ke</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 16 Jun 2016 16:41:52 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 26 Jun 2016 00:00:32 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 26 Jun 2016 00:00:32 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15335874" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 17 Jun 2016 11:08:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If this is only intended for use with the native OpenSSL implementation, then it should be defined in an OpenSSL-specific class.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15343851" author="kexianda" created="Wed, 22 Jun 2016 07:39:25 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;make sense.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We can use String like &quot;AES/CTR/NoPadding&quot; as transformation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;move the getAlgorithmBlockSize() /getName() in CipherTransformation to CryptoCipher&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;CipherTransformation.getAlgorithmBlockSize()  -&amp;gt; CryptoCipher.getAlgorithm()&lt;br/&gt;
CipherTransformation.getName() -&amp;gt; CryptoCipher.getBlockSize()&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The api will be similar to JCE.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15345610" author="kexianda" created="Thu, 23 Jun 2016 02:53:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub PR: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/61&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/61&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15348033" author="kexianda" created="Fri, 24 Jun 2016 09:01:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

Tree: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/9f1e2015&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/9f1e2015&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-81] improve factory api for constructing Random &amp; Cipher</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-81</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;currently, the client code to construct a CryptoRandom or CryptoCipher looks like this:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// code snippet (a)
&lt;/span&gt;Properties props = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Properties();
props.setProperty(
     ConfigurationKeys.COMMONS_CRYPTO_SECURE_RANDOM_CLASSES_KEY,
                OpensslCryptoRandom.&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class.&lt;/span&gt;getName());
CryptoRandom random = CryptoRandomFactory.getCryptoRandom(props);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;or using configuration file, it looks like :&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;# config file
secure.random.classes=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpensslCryptoRandom&quot;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// code snippet (b)
&lt;/span&gt;{
    Properties props = loadMyApplicationConfig();
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// ...
&lt;/span&gt;}
 
{
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// bussiness logic ...
&lt;/span&gt;    CryptoRandom random = CryptoRandomFactory.getCryptoRandom(props);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// ...
&lt;/span&gt;    CryptoCipher cipher = CryptoCipherFactory.getInstance(transform, props);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;disadvantages:&lt;br/&gt;
1. if client user just want use openssl engine,  trivial stuff in code snippet (a). it looks annoying.&lt;br/&gt;
2. Client user has to use the long long config key string such as  &quot;COMMONS_CRYPTO_SECURE_RANDOM_CLASSES_KEY&quot; or full name of classes&lt;br/&gt;
 Client user has to read source to  learn how to config the properties. &lt;br/&gt;
3. the implementation classes such as JavaCryptoRandom,  OsCryptoRandom and JavaCryptoRandom are public.&lt;br/&gt;
it would be hard to change library implementation in future.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;if we just &lt;b&gt;use a enum (RandomProvider or CryptCipherProvider)&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// code snippet (c)
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// client code looks simple and elegant now:
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//RandomProvider.OS or RandomProvider.JAVA
&lt;/span&gt;CryptoRandom random = CryptoRandomFactory.getCryptoRandom(RandomProvider.OPENSSL);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;still, client user can use configuration file&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;# config file
RandomProvider=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;OPENSSL&quot;&lt;/span&gt;
CryptCipherProvider=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;JCE&quot;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// code snippet 
&lt;/span&gt;{
    Properties props = loadMyApplicationConfig();
    RandomProvider randProvider = RandomProvider.valueOf(props.getProperty(p1));
    CryptoProvider cryptoRrovider =RandomProvider.valueOf(props.getProperty(p1));
}
{
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// bussiness logic ...
&lt;/span&gt;    CryptoRandom random = CryptoRandomFactory.getCryptoRandom(randProvider);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// ...
&lt;/span&gt;    CryptoCipher cipher = CryptoCipherFactory.getInstance(transform, cryptoRrovider);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;advantages:&lt;br/&gt;
1. Simpler API.  snippet (c) is simpler than snippet (a).  &lt;br/&gt;
2. Modern IDE will hint that CryptoRandomFactory.getCryptoRandom()  need a enum type (RandomProvider). client user do NOT have to search the long  key string such as &quot;COMMONS_CRYPTO_SECURE_RANDOM_CLASSES_KEY&quot;. Modern IDE will tell client user how to config&lt;br/&gt;
3. we don&apos;t have to expose the implementation classes as public&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12979827">CRYPTO-81</key>
            <summary>improve factory api for constructing Random &amp; Cipher</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="kexianda">Xianda Ke</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="kexianda">Xianda Ke</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 16 Jun 2016 13:52:29 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 29 Jun 2016 07:53:43 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 29 Jun 2016 07:53:43 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15333862" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 16 Jun 2016 14:14:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;+1&lt;br/&gt;
See related issues&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15333889" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 16 Jun 2016 14:25:51 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Note that the code currently also supports using System properties.&lt;br/&gt;
To ensure that such names cannot clash with other code, it&apos;s important to qualify them.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;i.e. using -DRandomProvider=JCE is not a good idea; the name may clash with other software.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Either:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;the code needs to use a unique prefix for System properties - e.g. org.apache.commons.crypto.RandomProvider&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;or the code should not offer configuration by System property.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;Note: since the o.a.c.c prefix is just used to provide a unique namespace, it would not need to follow any Java package renames that might be necessary to allow major API updates.&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15333921" author="kexianda" created="Thu, 16 Jun 2016 14:43:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~sebb@apache.org&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, agree with you. using System properties for configuration is not a good idea&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;i prefer to use a enum parameter for the factory, with the type info, IDE will tell user how to config when writing code.  we won&apos;t use Properties to construct Random or Cipher in the library implementation. if client user want to change the provider at run time, himself can decide how to do. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15334038" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 16 Jun 2016 15:50:48 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The current code uses the property parameter for two purposes: defining the class name and providing properties to the class instance.&lt;br/&gt;
That seems wrong - what if the instance uses the same property name to mean something else?&lt;br/&gt;
Moving the class name into a separate enum parameter would fix this.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However enums are only suitable for situations where the list of possible values are known in advance.&lt;br/&gt;
This is true for any implementations provided by the Crypto product (the enum can be extended when new implementations are provided), but what about external implementations?&lt;br/&gt;
Is the Crypto code intended to support 3rd party implementations?&lt;br/&gt;
If so, then there needs to be a way to instantiate these.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15335239" author="kexianda" created="Fri, 17 Jun 2016 02:26:22 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~sebb@apache.org&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; for your comments.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Crypto is mainly intended for a high performance using Openssl engine which is well optimized with hardware instructions acceleration. Currently, JCE&apos;s performance falls far behind Openssl.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So far as I know, Crypto is not intended for a scalable framework like JCE which supports 3rd implementations.&lt;br/&gt;
Take transformation for instance, JCE use string parameter (&quot;AES/CTR/NoPadding&quot;) to support any 3rd implementations. But Crypto code just use enum CipherTransformation. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15349885" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sun, 26 Jun 2016 00:18:15 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If the Crypto code is not intended to be extended by 3rd parties, then it makes sense to use an enum for the implementation classes - they can be enumerated.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If not, then it makes more sense to use a String which is either a full class name or an alias.&lt;br/&gt;
One way to make it easier to find the aliases is to use a separate class for the constants.&lt;br/&gt;
The Javadoc can then refer to the class, and IDEs should show the relevant entries in the class.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15352076" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 27 Jun 2016 23:53:08 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Another approach is to use public methods to return the class names of the built-in implementations.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It might also be possible to use an enum for the built-in classes and extend it with a mixin interface for the external classes &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;https://blogs.oracle.com/darcy/entry/enums_and_mixins&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://blogs.oracle.com/darcy/entry/enums_and_mixins&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15354745" author="kexianda" created="Wed, 29 Jun 2016 07:53:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Since it is already fixed in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-74&quot; title=&quot;Full class names make code more difficult to update&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-74&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-74&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, combined with some of the ideas in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-81&quot; title=&quot;improve factory api for constructing Random &amp;amp; Cipher&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-81&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-81&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, so close this jira.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-77] Hide Stream&apos;s Ctor with cipher parameter</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-77</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Stream has such two Ctor:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// denoted as (a)
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; CryptoInputStream(InputStream in, CryptoCipher cipher,
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; bufferSize, Key key, AlgorithmParameterSpec params)

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// denoted as (b)
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; CryptoInputStream(CipherTransformation transformation,
            Properties props, InputStream in, Key key,
            AlgorithmParameterSpec params)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;if use Ctor (b), client user don&apos;t have to construct a cipher.  make sense. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But, in Ctor (a), the cipher argument is create outside Ctor, then it is initialized in CryptoInputStream&apos;s Ctor. The cipher&#8217;s construction is scattered. It is a bit confusing.&lt;br/&gt;
Ctor (a) seem only used internally.  It would be better to hide Ctor (a) for user.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In future, we can consider this:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// don&apos;t pass key and iv param, the cipher should be initialized outside
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// similar to JDK, and more scalable to support GCM, CCM modes.
&lt;/span&gt;CryptoInputStream(InputStream in, CryptoCipher cipher,  &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; bufferSize)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;right now, we just hide Ctor (a) for user.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12979645">CRYPTO-77</key>
            <summary>Hide Stream&apos;s Ctor with cipher parameter</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
