<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-76] Remove log dependence</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-76</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;According the discussion in commons-dev, we will remove the log dependence of common-logging.&lt;br/&gt;
About the logging of native library failure, users of CRYPTO could get the information about whether native is enabled or native failure reason from org.apache.commons.crypto.utils.NativeCodeLoader#isNativeCodeLoaded() or org.apache.commons.crypto.cipher.Openssl#loadingFailureReason(), they could log these information in their system if they need.&lt;br/&gt;
At the same time, I think we can add an option for &quot;native only&quot; (Currently, when loading native failed, we log native failure error and use JCE implementation as fallback directly), the property in configuration may like &quot;ENABLE_FALLBACK_ON_NATIVE_FAILED&quot;, if user disable the option, it could throw an exception when loading native failed.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12979642">CRYPTO-76</key>
            <summary>Remove log dependence</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-75] ConfigurationKeys#COMMONS_CRYPTO_CIPHER_CLASSES_DEFAULT is not guaranteed constant</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-75</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;ConfigurationKeys#COMMONS_CRYPTO_CIPHER_CLASSES_DEFAULT contains a fully-qualified class name.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is not guaranteed to be constant if the package names ever have to be changed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The constant should be changed to an alias that is handled by the runtime code when creating the class.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12979323">CRYPTO-75</key>
            <summary>ConfigurationKeys#COMMONS_CRYPTO_CIPHER_CLASSES_DEFAULT is not guaranteed constant</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="sebb">Sebb</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 15 Jun 2016 10:29:54 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 29 Jun 2016 06:09:45 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 25 Jun 2016 13:26:47 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15336393" author="britter" created="Fri, 17 Jun 2016 16:27:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Can you provide an example how that code would look like? We should not over complicate things. We already have that nasty code that handles the sun.nio.Buffer calls.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15337705" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sat, 18 Jun 2016 09:53:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;As far as the user code is concerned, they would not see any difference; just the value of the constant would be changed once before initial publication.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As far as Crypto code is concerned, it would need to check whether the string was a full class path name or an alias; if an alias (i.e. no path segments) then convert that to the full class name.&lt;br/&gt;
Note that the alias could consist of the bare class name, making the conversion trivial.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;An alternative would be to replace the constant with a getter method. This would allow for internal class name changes automatically.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Since constant values may be inlined by the compiler, their values must not change once published; the new value may not be picked up by external code.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15337706" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sat, 18 Jun 2016 09:53:48 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;As far as the user code is concerned, they would not see any difference; just the value of the constant would be changed once before initial publication.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As far as Crypto code is concerned, it would need to check whether the string was a full class path name or an alias; if an alias (i.e. no path segments) then convert that to the full class name.&lt;br/&gt;
Note that the alias could consist of the bare class name, making the conversion trivial.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;An alternative would be to replace the constant with a getter method. This would allow for internal class name changes automatically.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Since constant values may be inlined by the compiler, their values must not change once published; the new value may not be picked up by external code.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15337758" author="britter" created="Sat, 18 Jun 2016 10:58:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If users are not affected, do we need this for 1.0?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15337770" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sat, 18 Jun 2016 11:19:25 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The user source code is not affected regardless of the value of the constant.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However any subsequent change will be binary-incompatible; users will have to recompile to ensure that the new constant value is picked up.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Public constants must only be used for values that won&apos;t change.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;==&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However I wonder whether the constant really needs to be public at all - does the user need to know the class name of the default?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15349644" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sat, 25 Jun 2016 13:26:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-74&quot; title=&quot;Full class names make code more difficult to update&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-74&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-74&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; Full class names make code more difficult to update&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;CIPHER_CLASSES_DEFAULT is only used by CryptoCipherFactory so move it&lt;br/&gt;
there and make it private&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Commit: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/1a33867f&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/commit/1a33867f&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Tree: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/1a33867f&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/tree/1a33867f&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Diff: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/diff/1a33867f&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-crypto/diff/1a33867f&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-72] CryptoCipherFactory.getInstance does unnecessary class instantiation</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-72</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The CryptoCipherFactory.getInstance method calls getCipherClasses which splits the string containing the class name(s) and then creates an instance of each (if possible) using ReflectionUtils.getClassByName.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However the getInstance method stops processing on the first successful class, so any subsequent entries are not used.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is wasteful; the call to ReflectionUtils.getClassByName should only be done if it is going to be used.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12979305">CRYPTO-72</key>
            <summary>CryptoCipherFactory.getInstance does unnecessary class instantiation</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="dapengsun">Dapeng Sun</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 15 Jun 2016 08:59:28 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 21 Jun 2016 03:04:12 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 21 Jun 2016 03:04:11 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-66] Warnings compiling - bootstrap class path not set</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-66</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The following appears in the build output:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; &quot;$JAVA_HOME/bin/javac&quot; -source 1.6 -target 1.6 -d target/jni-classes -sourcepath src/main/java src/main/java/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.java&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; warning: &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;options&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; bootstrap class path not set in conjunction with -source 1.6&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This can be fixed by adding something like the following to Makefile:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;$(JAVAC) $(BOOT) -source 1.6 ...&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;where&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;BOOT_LIB:=$(JAVA_HOME)/jre/lib/rt.jar&lt;br/&gt;
BOOT:=-bootclasspath $(BOOT_LIB)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The BOOT variables should probably be defined in Makefile.common&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12977849">CRYPTO-66</key>
            <summary>Warnings compiling - bootstrap class path not set</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="dapengsun">Dapeng Sun</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 11 Jun 2016 10:35:42 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 16 Jun 2016 13:31:50 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 16 Jun 2016 03:24:21 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15325830" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sat, 11 Jun 2016 11:44:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s not clear why the Java classes are compiled by the Makefile.&lt;br/&gt;
They are also compiled by the pom, but the class files end up in a different directory.&lt;br/&gt;
This could be fixed separately.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15329017" author="dapengsun" created="Tue, 14 Jun 2016 07:33:15 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank  &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~sebb@apache.org&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; for filing the ticket, I also think Java classes should not be compiled by the Makefile. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;pr created &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/51&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/51&lt;/a&gt; for fixing this issue. the warning will also disappear in the fix.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-65] Warnings compiling on MacOSX - JNIEXPORT redefined</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-65</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I get the following warnings on MacOSX:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; compiling OSInfo.java&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; &quot;$JAVA_HOME/bin/javac&quot; -source 1.6 -target 1.6 -d target/jni-classes -sourcepath src/main/java src/main/java/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.java&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; warning: &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;options&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; bootstrap class path not set in conjunction with -source 1.6&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; &quot;$JAVA_HOME/bin/javah&quot; -force -classpath target/jni-classes -o target/jni-classes/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCrypto1 warning&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; RandomNative.h org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpensslCryptoRandomNative&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; gcc -arch x86_64 -Ilib/inc_mac -I/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_79.jdk/Contents/Home/include -O2 -fPIC -mmacosx-version-min=10.5 -fvisibility=hidden -I/usr/local/include -Ilib/include -I/usr/include -I&quot;src/main/native/org/apache/commons/crypto/&quot; -I&quot;/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_79.jdk/Contents/Home/include/darwin&quot; -I&quot;target/jni-classes/org/apache/commons/crypto/cipher&quot; -I&quot;target/jni-classes/org/apache/commons/crypto/random&quot; -c src/main/native/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.c -o target/commons-crypto-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-Mac-x86_64/OpensslCryptoRandom.o&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; src/main/native/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.c:37:9: warning: &apos;JNIEXPORT&apos; macro redefined &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;-Wmacro&amp;quot;$JAVA_HOME/bin/javac&amp;quot; -source 1.6 -target 1.6 -d target/jni-classes -sourcepath src/main/java src/main/java/org/apache/commons/-redefined&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; #define JNIEXPORT _&lt;em&gt;attribute&lt;/em&gt;&lt;em&gt;((&lt;/em&gt;&lt;em&gt;visibility&lt;/em&gt;_(&quot;default&quot;)))&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;         ^&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_79crypto/cipher/OpensslNative.java&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; .jdk/Contents/Home/include/darwin/jni_md.h:29:9: note: previous definition is here&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; #define JNIEXPORT&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;         ^&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; 1 warning generated.&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; warning: &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;options&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; bootstrap class path not set in conjunction with -source 1.6&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; &quot;$JAVA_HOME/bin/javah&quot; -force -classpath target/jni-classes -o target/jni-classes/org/apache/commons/crypto/cipher/OpensslNative.h org.apache.commons.crypto.cipher.OpensslNative&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; 1 warning&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; gcc -arch x86_64 -Ilib/inc_mac -I/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_79.jdk/Contents/Home/include -O2 -fPIC -mmacosx-version-min=10.5 -fvisibility=hidden -I/usr/local/include -Ilib/include -I/usr/include -I&quot;src/main/native/org/apache/commons/crypto/&quot; -I&quot;/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_79.jdk/Contents/Home/include/darwin&quot; -I&quot;target/jni-classes/org/apache/commons/crypto/cipher&quot; -I&quot;target/jni-classes/org/apache/commons/crypto/random&quot; -c src/main/native/org/apache/commons/crypto/cipher/OpensslNative.c -o target/commons-crypto-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-Mac-x86_64/OpensslNative.o&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; src/main/native/org/apache/commons/crypto/cipher/OpensslNative.c:26:9: warning: &apos;JNIEXPORT&apos; macro redefined &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;-Wmacro-redefined&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; #define JNIEXPORT _&lt;em&gt;attribute&lt;/em&gt;&lt;em&gt;((&lt;/em&gt;&lt;em&gt;visibility&lt;/em&gt;_(&quot;default&quot;)))&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;         ^&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_79.jdk/Contents/Home/include/darwin/jni_md.h:29:9: note: previous definition is here&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; #define JNIEXPORT&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;         ^&lt;br/&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;exec&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; 1 warning generated.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-64] Code uses sun classes</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-64</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;$ mvn compile shows the following warnings:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; src/main/java/org/apache/commons/crypto/utils/Utils.java:&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;108,41&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; sun.nio.ch.DirectBuffer is internal proprietary API and may be removed in a future release&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; src/main/java/org/apache/commons/crypto/utils/Utils.java:&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;109,27&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; sun.misc.Cleaner is internal proprietary API and may be removed in a future release&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; src/main/java/org/apache/commons/crypto/utils/Utils.java:&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;109,64&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; sun.nio.ch.DirectBuffer is internal proprietary API and may be removed in a future release&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This means that the code will generally only run on specific Oracle Java versions.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>MacOSX El Capitan&lt;br/&gt;
</environment>
        <key id="12977846">CRYPTO-64</key>
            <summary>Code uses sun classes</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="dapengsun">Dapeng Sun</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 11 Jun 2016 09:55:04 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 16 Jun 2016 13:27:20 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 16 Jun 2016 03:26:15 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15325825" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sat, 11 Jun 2016 11:33:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It looks like the code is intended to be run only on JVMs that support the interface.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, the code does not compile unless the sun.nio.ch.DirectBuffer class/interface exists.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This restriction needs to be eliminated.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example by using Reflection or conditional compilation.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15328978" author="dapengsun" created="Tue, 14 Jun 2016 06:38:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~sebb@apache.org&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; pr created &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/50&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/50&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-45] Document how to build Commons Crypto</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-45</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;While trying to deploy the website I run into this problem:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;[INFO] --- maven-antrun-plugin:1.7:run (make) @ commons-crypto ---
[INFO] Executing tasks

make:
     [exec] compiling OSInfo.java
     [exec] &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;$JAVA_HOME/bin/javac&quot;&lt;/span&gt; -source 1.6 -target 1.6 -d target/jni-classes -sourcepath src/main/java src/main/java/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.java
     [exec] warning: [options] bootstrap &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;path not set in conjunction with -source 1.6
     [exec] 1 warning
     [exec] &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;$JAVA_HOME/bin/javah&quot;&lt;/span&gt; -force -classpath target/jni-classes -o target/jni-classes/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.h org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpensslCryptoRandomNative
     [exec] gcc -arch x86_64 -Ilib/inc_mac -I/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_65.jdk/Contents/Home/include -O2 -fPIC -mmacosx-version-min=10.5 -fvisibility=hidden -Ilib/include -I/usr/include -I&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;src/main/&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;native&lt;/span&gt;/org/apache/commons/crypto/&quot;&lt;/span&gt; -I&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_65.jdk/Contents/Home/include/darwin&quot;&lt;/span&gt; -I&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;target/jni-classes/org/apache/commons/crypto/cipher&quot;&lt;/span&gt; -I&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;target/jni-classes/org/apache/commons/crypto/random&quot;&lt;/span&gt; -c src/main/&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;native&lt;/span&gt;/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.c -o target/commons-crypto-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-Mac-x86_64/OpensslCryptoRandom.o
     [exec] In file included from src/main/&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;native&lt;/span&gt;/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.c:19:
     [exec] In file included from src/main/&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;native&lt;/span&gt;/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/org_apache_commons_crypto_random.h:22:
     [exec] src/main/&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;native&lt;/span&gt;/org/apache/commons/crypto/org_apache_commons_crypto.h:196:10: fatal error: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;openssl/aes.h&apos;&lt;/span&gt; file not found
     [exec] #include &amp;lt;openssl/aes.h&amp;gt;
     [exec]          ^
     [exec] 1 error generated.
     [exec] make: *** [target/commons-crypto-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-Mac-x86_64/OpensslCryptoRandom.o] Error 1
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m pretty lost, since I don&apos;t know c programming. Would be good to have some documentation on how to set up the development environment (on Linux/Mac OS/Windows) for building crypto.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12964137">CRYPTO-45</key>
            <summary>Document how to build Commons Crypto</summary>

                            <comment id="15265694" author="britter" created="Sun, 1 May 2016 10:10:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Not sure whether this should be a subtask of &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-1&quot; title=&quot;Prepare Apache Commons Crypto for Apache release&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CRYPTO-1&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CRYPTO-1&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15265699" author="britter" created="Sun, 1 May 2016 10:23:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Googling around I found this: &lt;a href=&quot;https://cryptography.io/en/latest/faq/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://cryptography.io/en/latest/faq/&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;seems like this is a common problem on Mac OS 10.11+. I don&apos;t know how to fix this yet.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15265861" author="britter" created="Sun, 1 May 2016 18:14:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Using this changes in the Makefile, I was finally able to run the native build:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;diff --git a/Makefile b/Makefile
index 9759b06..9624365 100644
--- a/Makefile
+++ b/Makefile
@@ -49,14 +49,14 @@ $(TARGET)/jni-classes/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative

 $(COMMONS_CRYPTO_OUT)/OpensslNative.o : $(SRC_NATIVE)/org/apache/commons/crypto/cipher/OpensslNative.c $(TARGET)/jni-classes/org/apache/commons/crypto/cipher/OpensslNative.h
        @mkdir -p $(@D)
-       $(CC) $(CFLAGS) -c $&amp;lt; -o $@
+       $(CC) $(CFLAGS) -I/usr/local/opt/openssl/include -c $&amp;lt; -o $@

 $(COMMONS_CRYPTO_OUT)/OpensslCryptoRandom.o : $(SRC_NATIVE)/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.c $(TARGET)/jni-classes/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.h
        @mkdir -p $(@D)
-       $(CC) $(CFLAGS) -c $&amp;lt; -o $@
+       $(CC) $(CFLAGS) -I/usr/local/opt/openssl/include -c $&amp;lt; -o $@

 $(COMMONS_CRYPTO_OUT)/$(LIBNAME): $(COMMONS_CRYPTO_OBJ)
-       $(CXX) $(CXXFLAGS) -o $@ $+ $(LINKFLAGS)
+       $(CXX) $(CXXFLAGS) -o $@ $+ $(LINKFLAGS) -L/usr/local/opt/openssl/lib
        $(STRIP) $@

 clean:
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;How ever, I got several failing tests when building with Java 8. Further more the site build failed because of malformed JavaDoc. So I switched to Java 6. Using Java 6, the native builds started failing again, this time with:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;[INFO] --- maven-antrun-plugin:1.7:run (make) @ commons-crypto ---
[INFO] Executing tasks

make:
     [exec] compiling OSInfo.java
     [exec] &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;$JAVA_HOME/bin/javac&quot;&lt;/span&gt; -source 1.6 -target 1.6 -d target/jni-classes -sourcepath src/main/java src/main/java/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.java
     [exec] &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;$JAVA_HOME/bin/javah&quot;&lt;/span&gt; -force -classpath target/jni-classes -o target/jni-classes/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.h org.apache.commons.crypto.random.OpensslCryptoRandomNative
     [exec] gcc -arch x86_64 -Ilib/inc_mac -I/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/1.6.0.jdk/Contents/Home/include -O2 -fPIC -mmacosx-version-miIn file included from src/main/&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;native&lt;/span&gt;/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.c:19:

     [exec] src/main/&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;native&lt;/span&gt;/org/apache/commons/crypto/on=10.5 -fvisibility=hidden -Ilib/include -I/usr/include -I&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;src/main/&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;native&lt;/span&gt;/org/apache/commons/crypto/&quot;&lt;/span&gt; -I/usr/local/opt/openssl/rg_apache_commons_crypto.h:67:10: fatal error: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;jni.h&apos;&lt;/span&gt; file not found
     [exec] #include &amp;lt;jni.h&amp;gt;
     [exec]          ^
     [exec] include -c src/main/&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;native&lt;/span&gt;/org/apache/commons/crypto/random/OpensslCryptoRandomNative.c -o target/commons-crypto-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-Mac-x86_64/OpensslCryptoRandom.o

                            <comment id="15268173" author="jerrychenhf" created="Tue, 3 May 2016 06:14:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks Benedikt  finding this.&lt;br/&gt;
This problem is due to the openssl version in the building OS is too lower. &lt;br/&gt;
We will document the specific requirement to build the native in one section of User Guide document.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Regards,&lt;br/&gt;
Haifeng&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15268214" author="britter" created="Tue, 3 May 2016 06:46:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hello Haifeng,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;d suggest to split this up into a User Guide and a Developer Guide. Most users won&apos;t be interested in the details of how to build the component.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;What do you think?&lt;br/&gt;
Benedikt&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15268372" author="jerrychenhf" created="Tue, 3 May 2016 08:43:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Benedikt,&lt;br/&gt;
Agree, your suggestion makes sense.  So,&lt;br/&gt;
The User Guide will cover how to refer the library and use it in their code.&lt;br/&gt;
The Developer Guide will cover how to get the code and how to setup the environment for building.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Regards,&lt;br/&gt;
Haifeng&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="15269490" author="cnauroth" created="Tue, 3 May 2016 20:11:48 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In this documentation, let&apos;s please include a note that running the tests requires installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength Policy.  I think some package maintainers include it automatically, but it&apos;s generally not included in a stock Oracle JDK download.  For example, the OpenJDK 7 package on my CentOS VM came with it.  We can hyperlink to the instructions for installing it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Without JCE Unlimited Strength, there will be a test failure in &lt;tt&gt;JceCipherTest&lt;/tt&gt;, like this:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-36] Fix crypto web link</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-36</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Replace &amp;lt;item name=&quot;Download&quot; href=&quot;/download_crypto.html&quot;/&amp;gt; with &lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;item name=&quot;Overview&quot;      href=&quot;/index.html&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12962900">CRYPTO-36</key>
            <summary>Fix crypto web link</summary>

            <title>[CRYPTO-34] JavaSecureRandom should throw Exception if it cannot create the instance</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-34</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;JavaSecureRandom should throw Exception if it cannot create the instance - there&apos;s no point in continuing as the main method nextBytes() will just throw NPE.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12962617">CRYPTO-34</key>
            <summary>JavaSecureRandom should throw Exception if it cannot create the instance</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-33] SecureRandom shadows JVM class</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-33</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The SecureRandom interface also exists  as a class in java.security.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This makes it awkward to use, for example in JavaSecureRandom the fully qualified name has to be used for the java class.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Ideally it should be renamed.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12962614">CRYPTO-33</key>
            <summary>SecureRandom shadows JVM class</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="kexianda">Xianda Ke</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 26 Apr 2016 14:34:03 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 3 May 2016 12:33:05 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 29 Apr 2016 09:14:17 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>0.9.2</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.0.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>SecureRandom</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15259378" author="jerrychenhf" created="Wed, 27 Apr 2016 01:59:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~sebb@apache.org&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; for pointing out this.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thinking about this problem, we also has Cipher, CipherInputStream case with the same situation. They are the best names in concept. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Although there are possibilities that users may use both Java Cipher and our Cipher in the same java file, yet can we consider this as an uncommon case so that we don&apos;t have to use a &quot;bad&quot; name to address it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Otherwise, we will have to use names like: CryptoCipher, CryptoSecureRandom, .. which are very redundant and uncomfortable.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Any thoughts?&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="15259415" author="jerrychenhf" created="Wed, 27 Apr 2016 02:26:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In Crypto internal implementation code, I would think that we can manage the name shadowing using fully qualified name as there are no many cases. And it will not impact the end user unless they have the cases mentioned above.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15259809" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 27 Apr 2016 08:54:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Name clashes &lt;b&gt;do&lt;/b&gt; affect developers if they use an IDE.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;e.g. Several times I have had java.sql.Date come up instead of java.util.Date.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We should not be making the situation worse.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Here are some suggestions:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;CipherInputStream =&amp;gt; CryptoInputStream&lt;br/&gt;
SecureRandom =&amp;gt; ISecureRandom (interface) or CryptoRandom&lt;br/&gt;
Cipher =&amp;gt; ICipher (interface)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s better to use redundancy in the name than to have ambiguous names.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15261557" author="jerrychenhf" created="Thu, 28 Apr 2016 05:19:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks Sebb for suggesting. We will use the following naming convention to avoid shadowing java classes.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Cipher -&amp;gt; CryptoCipher&lt;br/&gt;
SecureRandom -&amp;gt; CryptoRandom&lt;br/&gt;
CipherInputStream -&amp;gt; CryptoInputStream&lt;br/&gt;
CipherOutputStream -&amp;gt; CryptoOutputStream&lt;br/&gt;
CTRCipherInputStream -&amp;gt; CTRCryptoInputStream &lt;br/&gt;
CTRCipherOutputStream -&amp;gt; CTRCryptoOutputStream &lt;br/&gt;
...&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15261927" author="kexianda" created="Thu, 28 Apr 2016 10:26:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=jerrychenhf&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;jerrychenhf&quot;&gt;Haifeng Chen&lt;/a&gt; &amp;amp;  &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=sundapeng&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;sundapeng&quot;&gt;Dapeng Sun&lt;/a&gt;,&lt;br/&gt;
Please help review: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/23&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;pull request 23&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15261953" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 28 Apr 2016 10:56:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t think CTRCipher* exists in the JVM; no need to rename&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15261957" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 28 Apr 2016 10:58:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Only rename classes that clash.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;No need to rename CTRCipher*, JavaSecureRandom, Test*, OpensslSecureRandom etc&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15261964" author="ebourg" created="Thu, 28 Apr 2016 11:03:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Having the same names in Crypto and in the JDK is a nice feature IMO. It means people can just switch the import statements and benefit from the speed improvements (assuming the API is similar).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15262052" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 28 Apr 2016 12:26:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I think this only works if the APIs are &lt;b&gt;identical&lt;/b&gt; and remain so.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But name clashes still make development harder.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15263434" author="jerrychenhf" created="Fri, 29 Apr 2016 02:36:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;When deciding the same name, we original has the same thoughts with Emmanuel Bourg. &lt;br/&gt;
Unless, they use both Ciphers (Java Cipher and this Cipher) otherwise, developers will not has the same clashes. The both Cipher has similar functionality, the developers usually has no reason to use both Ciphers at same Java class. They will choose one or another.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If we finally decide to rename, I think we should name all classes consistently instead changing only those that conflicts. I consider the consistent names are very important for API usage. People will have no idea why the CryptoInputStream is named in this way while CTRCipherInputStream is named in another manner.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15263679" author="jerrychenhf" created="Fri, 29 Apr 2016 07:30:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;To move fast, we will go forward with changing all the names in a consistent manner. As this change will be related to a lot of files and to avoid conflict for other work such as spaces adjusting. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If folks has other opinion, let&apos;s continue discuss in this thread and we can create new pull request if needed. &lt;br/&gt;
Thanks,&lt;br/&gt;
Haifeng&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15263782" author="dapengsun" created="Fri, 29 Apr 2016 09:13:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Agreed with Haifeng for moving fast. Committed to master, we can create new pull request if needed&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-30] Mutable fields should be private</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-30</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Mutable fields should be private or possibly package-protected, never protected or public.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Once a field is published, it&apos;s impossible to ensure that it is properly synchronised, and it is impossible to change the implementation without API breakage.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Only constants should be published.&lt;br/&gt;
If there is really a need to access the field externally, this should be done through getters/setters, as those allow synchronisation to be added and make it easier to change the implementation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also, it&apos;s easy to add a getter/setter later if access is found to be needed.&lt;br/&gt;
Don&apos;t add one &apos;just in case&apos; because it cannot easily be removed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This observation applies to:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;StreamOutput.out&lt;br/&gt;
CTRCipherInputStream.streamOffset&lt;br/&gt;
CTRCipherOutputStream.streamOffset&lt;br/&gt;
CipherInputStream - lots of protected mutable state&lt;br/&gt;
CipherOutputStream - ditto&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12962563">CRYPTO-30</key>
            <summary>Mutable fields should be private</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="Ferd">Ferdinand Xu</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 26 Apr 2016 11:14:34 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 3 May 2016 08:18:02 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 29 Apr 2016 02:57:13 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>0.9.2</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.0.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Stream</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15259657" author="ferd" created="Wed, 27 Apr 2016 06:54:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~sebb@apache.org&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; Thank you for raising this up. I have made all of the variables as package private or private and provided Getter/Setter as protected. By this way, users are able to extend the existing crypto input/output stream.&lt;br/&gt;
PR was created at &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/19&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/19&lt;/a&gt;. Please help me review it. Thank you!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15259786" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 27 Apr 2016 08:37:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The getters should be protected, as the fields were protected.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The getters/setters should not be provided unless they are actually needed &lt;b&gt;now&lt;/b&gt;.&lt;br/&gt;
Don&apos;t add them &apos;just in case&apos; as that makes it much harder to change the implementation later.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15260365" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 27 Apr 2016 15:57:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;+1&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15263451" author="ferd" created="Fri, 29 Apr 2016 02:56:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Committed to the upstream at 98bec4c. Thanks &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~garydgregory&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; ,&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~sebb@apache.org&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; and &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=jerrychenhf&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;jerrychenhf&quot;&gt;Haifeng Chen&lt;/a&gt; for the reviews.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-29] Make sure Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE is consistent with JDK</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-29</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE should be an enum&lt;br/&gt;
Or is it supposed to be the same as Openssl.ENCRYPT_MODE?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In which case, why not use that?&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12962556">CRYPTO-29</key>
            <summary>Make sure Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE is consistent with JDK</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="dian.fu">Dian Fu</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 26 Apr 2016 11:05:33 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 3 May 2016 08:23:51 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 29 Apr 2016 03:00:51 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>0.9.2</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.0.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Cipher</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15259706" author="dian.fu" created="Wed, 27 Apr 2016 07:32:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for reporting this issue. I have create a &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-crypto/pull/17&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;PR&lt;/a&gt; to address this issue. This PR takes the similar way as the implementation of Cipher in JDK:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ol&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;The types of ENCRYPT_MODE and DECRYPT_MODE are primitive integer value. Using constant value instead of enum is consistent with the implementation in JDK.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Make sure the values of ENCRYPT_MODE and DECRYPT_MODE are consistent with JDK.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="15259779" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 27 Apr 2016 08:33:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If the constants are supposed to be consistent with the JDK, why not use the JDK values directly?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15259802" author="ebourg" created="Wed, 27 Apr 2016 08:49:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I guess to avoid using fully qualified names since the Cypher class also exist in the JDK.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15259813" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 27 Apr 2016 08:58:22 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In which case, define the local name using the JDK name.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;... static final int ENCRYPT_MODE = java....ENCRYPT_MODE;&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="15261341" author="dian.fu" created="Thu, 28 Apr 2016 01:15:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~sebb@apache.org&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; and &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ebourg&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ebourg&quot;&gt;Emmanuel Bourg&lt;/a&gt; for the review. Updated the patch.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15263452" author="dian.fu" created="Fri, 29 Apr 2016 03:00:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~sebb@apache.org&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; and &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ebourg&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ebourg&quot;&gt;Emmanuel Bourg&lt;/a&gt; for the review. <item>
            <title>[CRYPTO-26] Utility classes should not have public constructors</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-26</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Utility classes should not have public constructors&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12962460">CRYPTO-26</key>
            <summary>Utility classes should not have public constructors</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>

            <title>[CRYPTO-1] Prepare Apache Commons Crypto for Apache release</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRYPTO-1</link>
                <project id="12320024" key="CRYPTO">Commons Crypto</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;This is an umbrella task tracing the 1st Apache release for Apache Common Crypto.&lt;br/&gt;

                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12959043">CRYPTO-1</key>
